caption: First time ever trying Indian food and I have to say this place really impressed me their food is super delicious highly recommend for anyone. Plus the staff is super friendly and always checking up on you.

Had a great brunch here with my mom. We’d both never tried Indian food, but our waitress Palovi was so knowledgeable and gave many helpful suggestions! Everything we ordered was absolutely delicious esp the lamb curry. Service went above and beyond. Overall, restaurant had a very comfortable atmosphere and we both really enjoyed ourselves.

We have ordered from Adda multiple times. Totally love their Goat Biriyani! Also tried Indo Chinese and it’s pretty good! Happy to have a new Indian Food option close by. We will be ordering from here regularly.
Delicious food, reminded me of Bombay. Chicken lollipop is a must-try!

We already ordered three times from this place (twice with coworkers). My husband and I have tried their palak paneer, paneer kadhai, paneer makhani, malai kofta, veg biryani, paneer chili dry and cauliflower Manchurian. So far we liked all their dishes but loved their malai kofta. It was sooo DELICIOUS! Finally an Indian restaurant which does not ignore vegetarian menu items when it comes to flavor and taste. We def be going back for more.

Have tried multiple dishes from here and they have never disappointed me. My personal favorite is their Boneless Chicken Biryani. Their Chicken Lollipop is a must try. Finally there's a good Indian restaurant in the Little Italy neighborhood. Hope you folks succeed  :)

We ordered the butter chicken and lamb vindaloo. It is phenomenal. The sauce is perfect and the meat is extremely tender and flavorful! The naan? Bomb!!  Also, the staff is helpful and so accommodating. I appreciate the service provided!

I have been here a couple times. All the biryanis, the andra lamb curry, and the chicken lollypop were great. The portions are on the smaller end, but the food is rich and filling. The gulab jamun was stale, however, this might be because there isn't in-person dining to make it fresh. Overall the food was good.
wonderful food, we ordered biryanis and chicken appetizers perfectly spiced Kudos to the chef . Two thumbs up!!! Looking for dine in soon.
Food is excellent! New favorite spot in the city for Indian cuisine.
As a Desi,  this is the Best indian food in the downtown area!

I wanted my bf and his brother to try out the Indo-Chinese food as they had never tried before. I got them from Adda, and they REALLY LOVED it <3 . The customer service is amazing and the food here is phenomenal

We ordered both veg, non-veg and Chinese. Veg was good expect maanchurion is over fried little bit bitter . Non-veg is pathetic I) chicken lollipop- look like tandoori chicken fried 2) mutton chap:- not at all worth of cost. 3) kheema and pavbhaji:- both are not full means they gave 32oz container but both are less than half fill.

So excited to have this place in the neighborhood! My husband and I have ordered several times, and always look forward to it. The food is delicious and the spice level is spot on. Service is super friendly and it is easy to park in front to run in for pickup. I look forward to days ahead where we can dine in, too!
Great food, loved everything I tried, thus far.

Worst Indian food I’ve had in Chicago, totally bland, completely burnt, tasted like a few days old cooked.  Naan was stale and dry.  I live in Little Italy and we’ve ordered from many other Indian options in the immediate and surrounding area, I don’t recommend this place.  ✌🏾
Good , new place near UIC and little Italy  Spicy food if you want, good variety, and open for pick up during Covid-19  Tasty authentic Indo Chinese food

By far one of my favorite Indian cuisines.  The samosas are delicious, perfect in size and decent in price. The chicken biriyani was full of flavor and not to spicy. I will definitely order out again.
Got the Gum Aloo Gobi it was delicious!

We decided to try Food at Adda restaurant on Super Bowl day. The food was warm and delicious. We ordered many things and the winners were Onion Pakoras, Peshawari Chhole, Butter Chicken, Gobhi/Aloo and Naans. The hostess Pallavi was very polite, courteous and helpful. Will definitely go back and recommend it to our friends.
Best biryani, fried rice and kebabs i have tasted in USA. Must try!!
Chicken korma, chicken 65, and lollypop chicken were all fantastic! Very cute decor inside as well.

Food was pretty average . But the business owner Ms Palavi  was extremely rude and I haven’t seen someone be rude to their customer to this extent. She  kept cut  the call between the order just when I was reaching for my wallet to dictate my card details. She literally had no customer but when I was asking her query regarding my food, she kept mentioning, I have 1000s of customer and kept insulting just bcoz I asked if theirs is any student discount. I have never seen someone more rude when they are new in town and food is pretty average. I mean I tried your food once and the next time I wanna eat Indian food , I know Siri and Curry on fire are on the same st with much better food and appreciation for their customers. I didn’t ask you for free food Ms Pallavi, so next time you get a customer, please remember your arrogance is gonna make sure it’s their last time.
I'm always on the lookout for good Indian food and I've been eyeing this place even for they opened because it looked so cool from the outside. Finally tried it and it didn't disappoint.

On a whim my wife asked to support our new local business.  Ordered the Palak Paneer (Mild), Butter chicken(Mild) and lamb vindaloo (medium).  From an authenticity perspective, the spice was spot on, especially for me.  Give it a try. Especially the garlic naan
Workers are not fast currently. I ordered food yesterday and it took a lot of time for a delivery. Food packaging is not appropriate and it disappointed me a lot. So poorrr!!!
Really great chicken marsala and garlic naan bread, definitely coming back!

The food was great! Lots of great vegetarian and non-vegetarian options, and the naan is amazing. Also the inside of the restaurant is beautiful, so we're looking forward to when indoor dining opens back up.
Delicious Indian Cuisine! I ordered the Butter chicken, Chicken masala, and Lamb vindaloo. All the dishes had amazing flavor and I would highly recommend ordering.

NOW IMAGINE THIS :  YOU ' RE HUNGRY AT HOME AFTER A NICE DAY FASTING IN SILENCE .  YOU FREQUENT A LOT OF THE SAME FOOD SO YOU DECIDE TO TRY SOMETHING NEW .  IN 2021 , YOU CAN SAFELY RELY ON GOOGLE MAPS TO NAVIGATE ANY URBAN JUNGLE  WITH EASE .  " INDIAN " APPEARS AS A BLIP .  " OH , AND IT ' S CLOSE BY ? "  " OH , AND IT ' S AFFORDABLE FOR STUDENTS ? "  " OH SH- WE GON ! "  NEXT THING YOU KNOW , YOU THERE !  ENCHANTING DARK WOOD . EARTH EVERYWHERE . SURROUNDED BY LOVE INSTANTLY !  AMAZING FOOD . AMAZING CARE .  ( $20 SPENT HERE COULD GET YOU 2 DAYS WORTH OF FOOD . )  BE NICE  BE KIND  BE GRATEFUL  OR DON ' T BOTHER .  ( ( ( • . +D . • ) ) )
Food tasted stale, chicken was so dry and noodles were soggy and tasteless. We were so excited to order from this place, it took 1hr 45 minutes to deliver and food wasn’t good at all.
One of the best food I had in the recent times!

Wanted to try Adda last night as it was recommended by a few people and had great reviews. We had high expectations and it did not disappoint!! There were so many things on the menu we wanted to try! We ended up getting veggie samosa, onion pakora, chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken and lamb vindaloo. My husband likes spicy and I prefer mild and I love that they give us the level of spice option so we can both have the best experience. The chicken tikka masala was one of the best I’ve had and the flavors of everything were amazing. We ordered for pickup and everyone we spoke to were sooo nice!! We will definitely be adding this to our takeout rotation!
Taste of everything is just fabulous and served generously. Top of the list in my go to places.
Nice food tried it for the first time today and really enjoyed it

By far, one of the best Indian restaurants in Chicago. The food is authentic and great. The best Indo-Chinese food in US so far. The biryani is awesome and a must have dish from this restaurant. Kudos to the chef. I love this restaurant. A big thumbs up to it. Just awesome.

By far the best food I have eaten since moving to the city. Everything I ate was outrageously delicious, I couldn't eat it fast enough. The restaurant itself smelled amazing and the ambiance was nothing short of beautiful. The staff consists of kind, welcoming and lovely people ready to serve you a fantastic meal.. I will be eating here again.
The service was amazing and the food was spectacular!! They had so many options for dishes and the ones we ordered were delicious!
Excellent! Wonderful eggplant The Onion Pakora should have been more krispy, but apparently it doesn't travel well.

FINALLY!!! A really good Indian place.  I ordered spice level medium and was pleasantly surprised I would agree with the medium level and also the flavor of the dishes was on par with the best I've had.  I will be back frequently.
I don't think it is open any longer.  Phone goes in answered and into a generic voice mail at 6 pm on a Friday night.  Too bad.  First dinner from there was good.
The food was delicious and flavorful . Prices are reasonable. Will definitely ordered again. Buffett may start soon.
Delicious!  Amazing flavor and spices!  I ordered garlic naan, butter chicken, and Goni Manchuria (an amazing cauliflower dish)!  First meal here but it will be part of my rotation going forward!

I'm going to rate this place and food honestly. This food was amazing. First off the samosas were incredible it had potatoes and peas inside and the outside breading was not greasy, and was nice and crispy. Then I had the shrimp soup and it was very fresh you can taste that the shrimp wasn't injected with chemicals like normal store bought shrimp and for me that's amazing. Lastly the pistachio ice cream was nice and cream omg the best ice cream ever you need to try. 5 stars for me.

We were so excited to try this new restaurant. The owners are so lovely and helpful and the food was delicious. Full of flavor, tasted very fresh and authentic. We walked inside to pick up and the ambiance looks great. We will be back for sure and hope the best for them.

Very authentic flavor. My grandmother from Allepey approved of the Allepey prawn. She confirmed with the chef that they grind their own coconut and use the half ripe mangos, just as they do in Kerala. Garlic naan was delicious, and overall it was well-priced and delicious.
Flavor was good Attendant was nice Salt was on the lower end

The best Indian food in Chicago! Chicken Korma was absolutely delicious and if you are craving for Indo Chinese then definitely try their chilly chicken. Hats off to the owner Pallavi and the chef. Wonderful customer service! Not to forget, the rice pudding was perfect!

With authentic taste wonderful customer service Adda is one of the best Indian food I have had so far in Chicago.  Chilli Chicken, Chicken Korma and Chicken Biryani were perfect for New Years Day. Thank you Adda for a delicious start to 2021.

All I can say is WOW!!! I’m pretty new to Indian food, so I was really nervous about ordering but the owner was so patient and understanding, taking the time to explain each dish, and even Recommending several dishes. Everything I ordered was DELICIOUS! From the curry, to the masalas, to the soup. Definitely my new spot. You won’t be disappointed.

I ordered food from this restaurant (Biryani and nonveg appetizers, desserts). The food was delicious, and the texture, portion size, the flavor of the food were the right. The spice level of food is good. Desserts Gulab Jamun and rice pudding were awesome.
Awesome food. Chicken biryani was really good! Huge variety of Indo-Chinese options available.

It's new to my neighborhood, I'm so glad I gave Adda a try. The hostess was friendly and informative making my first order one to remember. Succulent  Chicken Tikka Masala spiced to perfection worked perfectly with Cheese Chilly Nan (I recommend microwaving the latter for best flavor). Much as I would be tempted holding to the comfort zone of a "lucky" first order, I'm up for the challenge of going back to give other menu items "equal chow time." Adda is definitely that kind of place.
I think this is my new favorite Indian restaurant in the city. The food tastes as good as restaurant food in India. The Szechuan noodles, kheema pao, and butter paneer were all amazing.
Really tasty Indian food, ordered here 2 times now since it opened

It's elusive an eatery here with the appropriate North Indian taste! I am entertained by the way that they did not just dominate in furnishing us with an assortment of food cooking styles across the Indian Subcontinent yet in addition have the option to keep up a similar taste and nature of the item. Wish you an incredible accomplishment later on years!

Adda has provided an excellent menu, bringing in some refreshing options which are not so common with the Indian restaurants in the area. I have tried the shrimp masala, Kerela fish curry, fish koliwada, chicken lollipop and chicken biryani. All the dishes were delicious, with the right proportion of spices making the food tasty and enjoyable. The place decor is classy and on point. With the food quality, the ambience and the price you can't go wrong. Can't wait to dine in for the complete experience. I look forward to trying more options. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an Indian place.

Amazing food!  Picked up 2 Veggie dishes - Dal Tadka and Bhendi Masala, along with Indian bread.  The owner was very warm and welcoming. He sat down spoke at length about the menu/dishes and even offered pao bhaji for free.  Will visit again for sure.  Great menu and great location in little Italy.

Fantastic indian restaurant!! Ordered twice in the four days since it has opened. Indo-Chinese and Punjabi dishes are out of this world....please try their chilly chicken and shezwan noodles..its superb!!! Too good!!🤘🏻

Ordered for takeout on Christmas Eve, their opening night and the food was amazing! We ordered veg manchurian, onion pakora, chicken korma and biryani boneless chicken, and everything was very delicious. The portions are also pretty big for lots of leftovers.
Great food. Good service. Keep up the good work.

I ordered from UberEats. The food was delicious but the portion for the chicken was very small, there were not many pieces in my butter chicken for the price (14$). The naan was a little burnt but still tasty.
The food is really awesome.. it place serves authentic Indian cuisine... the portions are pretty good.. enjoyed the food. Their service is prompt and on time.
Delicious take-out and thoughtful service!  On opening day, we had chicken tikka masala and tandoori chicken plus samosas, all terrific and ready on time.  A great addition to Taylor Street!

Having a great Pav Bhajji in Chicago for the first time! The bread was crisp and soft, buttery enough and the spices were just right. Bhajji (of the spicy standard) was also good. Prices are reasonable and the ambience is amazing.

Fantastic new restaurant! I ordered from here for Christmas Eve and all the food was fantastic. The hostess even gave great recommendations on what would travel best as carry-out. The meal I had I would've paid double for based on how delicious it was. It's a must try for anyone in the neighborhood or anyone who wants a delicious, memorable meal. I'll definitely be eating here again, and I can't wait to dine in!
Great food! Please continue the same taste..!
Ordered goat biryani , chicken tikka and malai kofta ... the dishes were worth it! Service is excellent and place has nice ambiance! Keep it up!

We had real pleasure of being the first customer to order the food during the opening night. We ordered chicken tikka, Malai Kebab, Shrimp tikka and naan it was absolutely delicious. We are very excited to see this higher level Indian Restaurant in the Little Italy neighborhood with such a diversity of cultures. We can’t  wait to dine in when the time is appropriate. I highly recommend this new and classy restaurant.
Chicken tikka masala, mutton biryani, malai kofta, chicken lollipop taste worthy!! Warm welcome, quick service, excellent ambience: must go.
I ordered sheik-e-Lazaz and allepy prawn.both were good and delicious. Planning to try out more dishes.

The food was good, but they need to work on their timing. Even with pickup and an advance order the food was 40 minutes late. I set the pick up time about an hour after I placed my order online, and then arrived 25- 35 minutes after the app had estimated the food would be ready (so 1.5 hours since I ordered the food). Food still wasn’t ready. Came back in 10 and they got my order together.
Wooo best Indian restaurant in town .newly open love the food nice people keep it up good work guys

Quantity, quality, and good customer service.  As of dec 24th 2020 their food was great. We got the chicken korma, kerala pepper chicken and garlic Naan. The curries were both spicy (enough for my Indian girlfriend) and flavorful. The garlic Naan was good, but was a little dry. My reasoning for the 5 star review is because the quantity was more than any other Indian restaurant while still tasting just as good if not better. We have recently been having trouble with finding a decent Indian restaurant in the area and we will definitely be trying adda again. P.s. this is a real person leaving this review
